group_1.textRight: Buongiorno.
What are you so worried about?
As I told you yesterday, I have no suicidal@feelings whatsoever.

group_1.textLeft: It's just you have a history, so...

group_1.textRight: Okay, well, think whatever you want.
Here you are.
Why didn't you ask that before you took it?
Well, whatever. Just call it a simple@present to say "grazie".

group_1.textLeft: [chara:101201:effect_emotion_sad_0][se:7224_fall_into]Oh, the straw... It fell through the hole...

group_1.textRight: Well, I don't have another one. Just drink@it the best you can.

group_1.textLeft: What did you think of Magical Kirin?!
You must've liked it if you're thanking me@for it!

group_1.textRight: Oh, that.
I found out that it mostly just repeats@the same exact story.
That alone made it worth my time.

group_1.textLeft: Its beauty is in its formulaic approach!

group_1.textRight: The idiota is using complicated words out of@nowhere...

group_1.textLeft: The bad guy appears, and Kirin steals@something that would help beat them.
She's a "Phantom Thief Magical Girl", you@know? It makes sense!
And anyway, that's the stuff everyone looks@forward to the most when they read it!
Of course, there's the progression of@Kirin's blossoming love story too, andâ€”

group_1.textRight: Stop.
It seemed like you were just going to ramble@on and on without end...
But yes, it is as you say. It's enjoyable@despite how repetitive it is.
And I, Alina saw through that repetition to@the core of the work.
As such, I owe both you and Magical Kirin@my gratitude.
Really?

group_1.textLeft: Uh, actually I don't get it at all. Sorry.

group_1.textRight: It's repetitive, but it can get away with it.
Because at its core, it has an element@that entertains its readers.
I, Alina, am exactly the same.

group_1.narration: "Living Monochrome"@"Scream, Enlightened One"@"Pack of One"@"The Revived Dead"
All of my artwork so far that@has gripped people's hearts...
They symbolized that instant between@life and death, where emotions combust...@They all contain that same theme.

group_1.textLeft: So that's the "core" of your work?

group_1.textRight: No.
It's as you said. I'm presently taking@care of the class gerbil, no?
Did you forget what you told me?
Idiota...
But yes, you're quite right.@I, Alina, am an artist.
So even if I were to raise some gerbils,@there is meaning to it.
And that meaning goes deeper than the@theme of "Sentiment, Life, and Death".
I think the core of my work exerts its@influence from a much deeper level...
